Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I have stumbled across a rather interesting bug.

In order to board a pilot into my biplane cockpit

I attached a small blue stack separator to the side

Of the plane and then a probe core, then a pod.

I discovered that after attaching the probe core, when

You stage the seperator and the empty pod falls away

It is still reacting to my inputs. Even though I am focused

On the biplane.

Now, I know there is a mod that does dual control I am very

Keen to know if I can do it stock.

I have a few days of now so will have a go at it.

Has anybody else come across this bug??

MJ

Edited June 6, 2014 by Majorjim
added video.
I've only seen that right before I've had horrible craft ending symmetry glitches. Could you post a pic of the craft?
I recall Danny2462 doing something like this...

There is a bug where all vehicles within physics range (2.5km) respond to any control-inputs. Can't see how it would be useful, but there is a fix for it (in the tutorials section, I think).

*shouts* Claw? In your thread?
I will make a short vid and post it here.

Ok chaps,

Video in the first post.

MJ

I've had this happen too. Really irritating when it happens when you're trying to dock in Moho orbit with 10% RCS left xD. After switching crafts it stopped though.

Actually, I've had a similar glitch similar to yours. The launch clamps could still be fired.

I would suggest you check your console (ALT F2). I got a nullreferenceexception.
